reviewText: I could not finish this movie. Got too boring in the first half hour. Sad cause I like Diane Keaton.

Another screwball comedy with a good cast, this one with Diane Keaton as a kooky woman who comes to stay with her son and his wife during a fight with her husband. At first it's more irratating than funny, but it does have some good laughs as the film progresses(the Funeral is a highlight). It's nothing special, but it's not all that bad either.

I have an inexplicable fondness for this slight, oddball 2008 comedy. It's not the catastrophic train wreck others would have you believe it is. Instead, director/screenwriter Vince DiMeglio has concocted a screwball farce with off-kilter characters that alternate between endearing and irritating, often in the same moment. The film is by no means a significant milestone in cinema, but it does generate some unexpected laughs mostly due to Diane Keaton's freewheeling performance. The Oscar-winning actress may appear to be slumming here, but her dexterity is put to the test as one incredibly needy and critical mother. Usually a second banana in films, Dax Shepard (Baby Mama) plays Noah, a physical therapist who gets fired and wants to change his luck by starting his own practice. Married to Clare, a schoolteacher who wants to have a baby badly, he finds his wife's cousin Myron, a dweeby screenwriter wannabe, parked on the couch. Later, Noah's mom Marilyn drops by unexpectedly after a big fight with his father. She moves in with her five dogs, all named Sammy Higgins, and together they find jobs at the carpet store where Noah used to work. Her flighty incompetence gets them both fired, and things get even worse from there. Shepard relies heavily on a deadpan delivery to carry his performance. Liv Tyler (The Lord of the Rings) is sweet as Clare, and Mike White (The Good Girl) manages to make his creepiness oddly likeable. But it's Keaton who amps up her innate zaniness to draw a beleaguered level of sympathy to a character that could have been buried in sitcom-level clichs. For evidence, watch her work the scene in the Denny's-style restaurant or trade barbs with Shepard in the funeral scene. Production values are on the modest side. The 2009 DVD features an entertaining commentary track from DiMeglio (who reveals that the story is somewhat autobiographical) and a brief making-of featurette.

This film was okay so I cannot recommend it unless you are big fan of Diane Keaton, Liv Tyler or Dax Shepard. The movie had some pretty funny moments (most of it is crude) but the bad acting (Liv Tyler's delivery was wooden), over acting (Diane Keaton was over the top) and lame script did not make for a great comedy. There are better overbearing mom movies out there to watch (Monster-in-Law (New Line Platinum Series) comes to mind). This movie was watched while I was sick and taking NyQuil D so I might have added a star too many.

This movie has a funny concept that usually can't fail - overbearing parents. However, Smother just isn't that funny. Rather than being funny, Diane Keaton's character often just appears annoying and crazy. Rather than smothering her son, she seems like she should be put in an insane asylum. I don't think I laughed much at all throughout the movie. At the end, I just ended up feeling depressed about the characters complaining that they had wasted their lives. I was also upset when Dax Shepard yelled at the geese. Not funny. If you want really funny comedy about a smothering mother, check out the sitcom Everybody Loves Raymond - The Complete Series.

Oh . . where to begin. First of all, I love Diane Keaton - in fact I like all of the lead characters. But this movie is SO bad - I couldn't believe how bad it was. It supposed to be about Diane Keaton being a 'smothering' mother - huh?? You don't even see her do that much. Maybe it's the writing, I don't know. It just didn't make any sense at all. Except for Ken Howard (Diane Keaton's husband) - he was the best of the lot - the second star is for him.

Figured I would give it a try in the store and see how people take Keaton these days. She was cast well to play the thoroughly irritating and overbearing mother, in tow with the token dog pack and oblivion to her psychoses.

Dax Shepard plays her married son who must deal with all of his pre-mid life crisis happenings in a way that can entertain an audience for 92 minutes. Liv Tyler plays his wife, and even as admitted in the writing she is present only as a "sperm receptacle", her screen time gathered no accolades. After playing it several times the reactions of customers were mixed. Most swayed towards enjoying some of the comedic moments, but any prolonged viewing garnered irritation. It became apparent this would be one of those films some of the gals would watch solo, because in every group people would look at each other and laugh how cliche or contrived it felt.

The DVD documentary lasts 8 minutes about how awesome and perfect everyone is to work with. Dax actually had funnier lines of self importance in this than in the movie. Gets a nice Ben Stiller slam in there. Recommend as rental for the Keaton fans, and maybe an owner for the Dax fans that want to see him try to carry a non-slapstick light comedy on his own.

I love Diane Keaton's acting and she's terrific in "Smother", but WHY did she have to smoke (UGH!) Dax Shepard's dry wit is a hoot and Liv Tyler is a pleasure to watch. The bonus features should be interesting.
I love Diane Keaton but I didn't like this movie
It was ok, could have been funnier!!
A little childish.
Boring
Did not like it

This movie is so horrible, I couldn't watch the entire thing. I LOVE Diane Keaton, but this part was not a good thing for her. The characters are so annoying, I was "SMOTHERED"! This is a terrible movie.
Love Diane Keaton in everything!
weird

Although I've long been wary of any movie with Diane Keaton in it, I went ahead and rented this because of Dax Shepard. That was a mistake. We loved Shepard in the hit TV series, Parenthood. Unfortunately, he apparently only knows how to play the same character, and it didn't work in this pathetic excuse of a film. We were so disappointed in the utter lack of laughs that we shut it off a quarter of the way through.

As for Keaton, she's much better in straighter roles, e.g., opposite Michael Douglas in And So It Goes. She fails miserably in the I Love Lucy/Meg Ryan goofball schtick, instead just coming off as completely annoying..
not good for a Diane Keaton movie
Boring
Funny movie!
Really really a good movie. The story line was so down to earth, so many families can relate to this movie.
Disappointing

Ok. So, the first 15 minutes of Keaton's hyperkinetic personality are annoying and I had to stop watching it. But, later I came back and finished it and I'm glad I did. It is funny and cute. Keaton's character mellows out and Keaton does what we love about her. Not a bad way to spend your time.

What can I say about Diane Keaton...  She is as wonderful today as she was in Annie Hall.  She has not changed at all.  Unlike some other actors of her generation, she will not compromise her reputation by making a terrible and totally disgusting and distasteful movie for the almighty dollar...
Cheesy
funny

Don't waste your time or money.  Liv Tyler's acting is so bad - like she's not even there and barely had the energy to get through her scenes.  Diane Keaton's character is just too looney and over the top - I actually wound up fast forwarding through the movie to see if it would get better, but it never did.  Really a pathetic excuse for a movie. Yuck.
It was funny.
Two of my favorite actors in the hilarious comedy...Dax Shepard & Diane Keaton.  It's silly but in a good way -- for a good laugh, I will watch this one again & again.
Very funny movie
I normally LOVE Diane Keaton, but the writing in this was atrocious that even her acting skills couldn't save it. Her character was so stereoptypical and predictable. I ended up turning it off.
Love Diane Keaton.  Not even she could save this movie.
very good and  funny movie

Sadly this was a real looser of a movie. Diane Ketan really played her part with serious over the top stupidity. She really is to good of an actress ,usually she is one of my favorites. Rent her other movies.
funny! crazy! understandable...glad it was not me from all angles, but happy ending being strong with who you are!
Very funny!  Loved it!
Too trite but sort of cute.  I use these films to help me get to sleep at night,  this one worked well.
Funny movie.  Enjoyed Diane Keaton in this movie.

so terrible i could not finish watching it

Cute show. Always love Diane Keaton.
Should not have been made.  I do not think it rates even one star, however to comment I had to mark one..
Good acting

I enjoyed this movie with Diane Keaton and other cast, I didn't know that she was so funny.  There was one scene that I didn't like which was the presentation by the carpet company executive which was explained to the Mom and Son about their new jobs at a carpet company.  I believe the scene was to gory and should be taken out because its simply horribe and I wouldn't want my children or any one for that matter to view such a clip from the movie.

I love the stars in the film and the idea wasn't bad, but writer and storyline was terrible.  With a good cast like this you would expect a better plot, but it is the storyline that suffers badly.  The mother didn't come across as smothering, but just annoying.  With all of her dressed dogs you probably could have gotten some funny moments with that, but it wasn't explored.  Instead they had a goofy cousin staying with them played by Mike White who didn't even need to be in the movie.  The Mom was so annoying you felt great for the father who was beginning to enjoy her being gone.  Storyline - the obnoxious mom leaves the dad after an argument and moves in with the son along with her five dogs who all have the same name.  You feel like the writer and director sat around trying to figure out what other stupid things they could put in the movie.  Not "Hilarious", maybe amusing in some spots.  You might pass some time with this one, but you probably will not enjoy it.  Not family friendly.
Just goes to show you that even good actors cannot survive a poor script...
I like Diane Keaton. This is the first movie of her's that I did not like.
Exactly what I was looking for!
great
Suitable only if you are really, really bored.
Lots of crude language.
This movie was great, so funny, very real at times if you have a mother in law, Keaton is a great actress for the mother in law.
My daughter recommended this movie. I think it reminded her of me! While it was not as funny to us (her parents) it was enjoyable.
This is a sleeper...not much heard about, but hilarious.  I've watched it dozens of times. Highly recommend! It will not disappoint.
ok... so this movie make me laugh, liv tyler is amazingin this movie honestly i just sawher beacuse she was in it,!
Still funny as heck!
Was okay
Great movie. Very cute.
Stupid and slow movie. Waste of money.

I can't believe I actually bought this movie.  I was sucked in by all the good actors involved.  I can see why they named it Smother.  Diane Keaton will drive you absolutely nuts in this movie!  She goes a million miles an hour and goes nowhere in this movie except driving her son Noah (Dax Shepard) and you the viewer absolutely crazy because of all the crazy stuff she does.  I don't recommend this movie to anybody unless you want to waste your money like I did.

CUTE,  "FEEL GOOD" MOVIE!...
BUT,  OF COURSE! ....IT'S
DIANE KEATON! DUH!!
waste of money. wished i would have never bought this movie.
Wonderful, warm funny movie!  I've watched it 3 times already, and will watch it again!

I rented the disc of this movie from Netflix and ended up watching it 3 times before I sent it back. First, I watched it by myself, then I told my husband he had to watch it with me cause it's really good, then I watched it a 3rd time with the spanish sub-titles on (so I can learn spanish). The mother in this movie is supposed to be horrible, but I really liked her!  Being called Smother, I thought she would be more overbearing, kinda like Beverly Goldberg cause she's often referred to as a smother. (I love her too, though!) There are so many funny parts to this movie! I loved the funeral scene, I love the mother's personality. Dax Shepard is funny and believable and I really like Liv Tyler, but she was almost too nice and understanding that it didn't seem very realistic. The cousin Myron was great. I want to buy this on DVD cause I would definitely watch it again.
Cute
